meanings.definition: To evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: I will assess the situation before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will assess our understanding of the lesson with a quiz.
meanings.sent3: Let's assess how fast the turtle can run in a race!
meanings.sent4: She could assess the storm approaching by the dark clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to assess the evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To determine the value or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The appraiser will assess the price of the antique vase.
meanings.sent2: It is important to assess the cost of the project before starting.
meanings.sent3: I will assess the weight of the cake by lifting it.
meanings.sent4: She could assess the distance of the finish line by looking ahead.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler needs to assess the value of the diamond ring.

meanings.definition: To make a judgment or decision about something.
meanings.sent1: The judge will assess the guilt of the defendant.
meanings.sent2: It's time to assess which movie to watch tonight.
meanings.sent3: Let's assess if the cat really caught the mouse or not.
meanings.sent4: She could assess the best route to take based on the traffic.
meanings.sent5: The manager needs to assess the performance of the employees.
